preqs: Students must have passed ECB2331 or ECG2730 or ECF2731 or ECW2730 or ECS2730 AND ECB2731 or ECG2731 or ECW2731 or ECS2731 or ECF2731 or ECF2931 before undertaking this unit.

rules.ruleString: Must be enrolled in course type {10, 41, 50}
Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {ECB2730, ECB2731, ECF2731, ECG2730, ECG2731, ECS2730, ECS2731, ECW2730, ECW2731} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS}
Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {ECB2731, ECF2731, ECG2730, ECG2731, ECS2730, ECS2731, ECW2730, ECW2731} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS}
Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {ECB3121, ECC3690, ECF3121, ECG9121, ECW3121}
Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {ECB3121, ECC3690, ECF3121, ECG9121, ECW3121}
Must be enrolled in course type {10, 41, 50}

description: The pure theory of international trade. Trade and income distribution, economic growth and changes in trade, bases for trade and gains from trade. Trade policy. Tariffs, quotas, subsidies, import discrimination and other national policies affecting trade. The foreign exchange market. Determination of exchange rates, the balance of payments, modern foreign exchange policies and the threat of unstable exchange rates. Regional trade agreements.
